title: Chelsea to decide whether to extend John Terry's career at the end of the season
text:
Chelsea to decide whether to extend John Terry's career at the end of the season The skipper had to wait and take a hefty wage cut last season Share Terry and Conte (Photo: Darren Walsh) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Antonio Conte has revealed Chelsea will decide on John Terry's future at the end of the season. 
Blues' legend Terry is being made to wait to hear whether he will move into the 20th season of his professional career. 
The former England skipper was force to twiddle his thumbs until May last season before Roman Abramovich finally offered him an additional year - albeit with a hefty pay cut. 
Despite making him suffer, Conte is keen to keep the 36-year-old defender on - but will not confirm Terry's stay until the end of the campaign. Terry has made over 700 appearances for Chelsea (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Antonio Conte backs under-fire Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger - "he deserves respect for his work" Conte will make a decision on Terry at the end of the season (Photo: Getty) 
“I hope no, I don’t know about this, I prefer every situation to face at the end of the season when it will be the right time,: Conte said. 
“John is doing great work this season on and off the pitch, he is very important. He is the captain and is working very well and helping me a lot in the changing room to translate the right message. He is an important player for us” 
Terry has only managed four Premier League appearances this season but has been a regular in the FA Cup. 
Chelsea take on Manchester United on Monday night in the cup - but Conte has yet to decide on Terry's involvement. Terry has passed on the leadership to Gary Cahill (Photo: Darren Walsh) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
